name: Phoenix Hotel, a Joie de Vivre hotel

reviews.title: The way to experience the REAL San Francisco!
reviews.text: Having been to San Francisco before, my partner and I decided that we wanted a REAL San Francisco hotel; centrally located, with some personal touches, inexpensive yet with the amenities we would pay 2 or 3X's for normally. And as for the location, sure the Tenderloin is sketchy but you are truly in the heart of EVERYTHING!

Our room was pleasant and had all of the amenities any traveller would need. Yes, it was loud until early morning Sunday but hey, you should know that weekends can be that way before you go. The restaurant, Bambudda Lounge, which is actually in the hotel but not affiliated, was a great place for an ecelectic and delicious dinner. It catered to a wide variety of a crowd.
reviews.title: Best Deal in S.F.

likes.liked: — Staff was excellent! Pool was Great! Room was affordable!

reviews.title: Perfect for the girls!
reviews.text: And, as for the service at the Phoenix - impeccable. The front desk was very helpful on anything we asked - from restaurants to directions. Overall, we had a GRAND time in San Francisco and the Phoenix helped!
Kevin Palmer
reviews.title: Old SF feel + tiki lounge style & hip elegance

likes.disliked: — I wish there was early morning coffee in the lobby

reviews.title: Hidden Gem
reviews.text: Frank Schneider

Really a fun place to stay. Wonderful restaurant on site. We were probably the oldest guests in residence and dining--but felt welcomed and comfortable. Had some concerns about the noise from the patio bar--but it ended amazingly promptly at around 11 PM! Easy walking (away from the Tenderloin) toward VanNess--multi-screen indie movie theatre nearby--many dining options. We were staying because of promixity to the Federal Building, but will return just for fun. It's also a real bargain and we belong to the Joy of Life affinity club for this small hotel chain, so had a couple of extra goodies thrown in for free.
reviews.title: Fun, Inexpensive Place to enjoy the Civic Center Area

likes.disliked: — Location near Tenderloin district of San Francisco

reviews.title: Bohemian Rhapsody in the City
reviews.text: This was my fourth stay here and I feel like this hotel is an old friend. The grounds are terrific- a tiny tropical-artsy oasis on the edge of the tenderloin. The staff is friendly and helpful, and this attidtude even seems to rub off on interactions with the other guests. The breakfast buffet is tasty and fresh, with quality coffee and teas, not the usual motel fare at all. The rooms are attractively
decorated, not elegant, but creative and comfy, and the price is right- especially when you take the free parking into account.
reviews.title: Loved the environment

reviews.text: Great atmosphere. The friendly environment that this place creates is unbeatable. The Bambudda lounge is awesome. The location is near the Tenderloin district, but if you are street smart you will be fine outside the hotel. The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because my room needed some renovations. But I was told that the hotel would be renovating pretty soon. I would definitely stay there again once renovations are done.
reviews.title: Great hotel. Will stay again next time...definitely!

likes.liked: — The beautiful courtyard, lack of street noise, shower

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I travel to San Francisco a lot and have had more than my share of less-than-desirable hotel stays there. But the Phoenix - I was very impressed. The courtyard/swimming pool area is beautiful and very relaxing. The room was spacious, clean and nicely designed. The shower was awesome. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The bed was comfy. I like the location - central to everything - on the edge of the Tenderloin but not in the worst part of it. There are many decent restaurants, bars and clubs within walking distance. The guests were, as a whole, quite young and hip. Because of the courtyard you don't get the street noise that you do in many other hotels in San Francisco. They let me check in quite early, which was very nice after a long, cramped, early morning flight from Chicago.
reviews.title: Lovely retro motel, clean and fun, good location.

likes.liked: — The novelty of a retro motel in San Francisco's Tenderloin

reviews.text: When I checked in at 3:00 P.M. my room was not ready, and a major party was going on outside in the courtyard with blaring rock music. I got into my room about 3:30 but the party may as well have been indoors. The rooms are quite exposed and have limited privacy. The party continued till about 8:00 P.M. The rest of the week was relatively quiet and peaceful.
reviews.title: Noisy, cheap
horrible experience
reviews.text: Also the room had no air conditioning, which is usually not a problem in San Francisco, but was that weekend.
On the other hand it's the cheapest hotel I've found downtown.
reviews.title: An Oasis in the big City!

likes.liked: — Funky style, warm and safe atmosphere.
likes.disliked: — bathrooms are being updated...this will be an improvement

reviews.title: Great bargain
reviews.text: i thought this would be an interesting hotel, the photographs all looked very cool and the price was definately on target.
When we arrived the check in was quick and friendly, we even hung out with Rachel at the front desk one night. That was the only good night we had.
reviews.title: Brilliant !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was at the Phoenix for both a Thursday and a Friday night. The first night, I had a standard King room. It was a bit loud, but that was more because there were tons of ambulances on the street. It got really quiet around 1am. On Friday I upgraded to a Delux King room and man it was worth it. It is quiet, private and fantastic. My room had a four poster bed, a sitting room, a nice bathroom and a fridge and a microwave. Also, the complementary wine was nice too. If you are going to stay here, join the Jois de Vivre club. You get free upgrades, free wine/cocktail/sparkling wine, and free wireless. I really enjoyed my stay and I highly recommend it. It is not the best place for walking, but it has a lot of style and great breakfast.
reviews.title: Rock'N'Rleax at Phoenix

reviews.text: I had accepted that the area we were going to be staying in was rough
reviews.title: Was dissapointed

reviews.text: and that it would be noisy and I was willing to accept all that as it has a great restaurant and bar on site. However you could never get into Bambuddah lounge as they constantly had it closed for private parties and then just closed over the 5 night. There are way better places to stay if you are going to do some touristy sites were
reviews.title: What a Great Place!

reviews.text: you can possibly have a quiet enough space for an afternoon nap at the very least before heading out as morning, noon and night that place is hard to get some uninterrupted sleep.
reviews.title: Good hotel in an OK location

reviews.text: A bunch of friends chose to stay at the Civic Center Inn up the street, but after checking out the Phoenix's website, I knew this is where I wanted to be. And I was not mistaken! The room was clean, bright, and a bit on the eccentric side...which was a good thing for me! The staff was friendly and incredibly helpful. I remember reading a review warning about noise from the club, but I didn't have a problem with it at all. The courtyard has its own flavor and, in a way, looked out of place from anything you'd think you'd see in San Francisco. But that's what made this place so great! My friends who visited me from the Civic Center Inn were jealous. For not much more money, I got a place that would make my trip far more memorable, a place that only added to my experience. Especially when compared to their bland choice. I plan on going back soon and trying out the lounge and the pool. But I guarantee you, I will be back to the Phoenix every time I go to the City!
reviews.title: Phoenix Hotel Rocks

aka: Phoenix Hotel, a Joie De Vivre Hotel Hotel
description: Funky, irreverent, and young-at-heart, The Phoenix Hotel caters to touring bands and travelers with a creative spirit. A 44 room mid-century motor lodge with a lush courtyard and heated outdoor pool. It's an oasis in the heart of San Francisco on the edge of the gritty Tenderloin and three blocks from City Hall. Guests get complimentary onsite parking and a poolside coffee, tea and muffins to start the day. Art from local artists decorates the rooms and the courtyard gardens.
